summary: The document, released under the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992, details the involvement of IDEN A, a wealthy and prominent New Orleans businessman, with JMWAVE, a covert operation. IDEN A was recommended to JMWAVE and cleared by Headquarters in December 1962. He served in various roles, including as the President of the cover company YOCOUGH, and used his own company to fund JMWAVE operations. The document also outlines his interactions with other individuals and entities related to JMWAVE activities, including a request for the assignment of a 201 number for IDEN A to formalize his role within JMWAVE operations.
key_findings: IDEN A played a significant role in supporting JMWAVE operations, both through his business and by acting as a spotter for other businessmen.
The document underscores the covert nature of JMWAVE operations, including the use of cover companies and individuals to support these activities.
It illustrates the complex network of individuals and entities involved in covert operations during the early 1960s.
The request for a 201 number for IDEN A indicates an effort to formalize his involvement in JMWAVE operations.
keywords: President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act
